text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly addresses the 'applicable law test' in Section 3. It explains that the counterclaim must be grounded in obligations applicable to the investor under the applicable law, noting that this law can be domestic law (Brazil's environmental law) or international law, depending on the BIT's applicable law clause and the procedural rules (UNCITRAL Art. 35(1)). It cites leading cases (*Saluka*, *Perenco*) where the tribunal's authority to apply domestic law was the deciding factor for admissibility.", "criterion_id": "47ddb755-e7f6-4ead-a8aa-80db8a87a3b9"}
